Table.Description: Defines a port. Port value will be used later by a device definition.
Defines what protocol the SECS driver should use.
Identifies which COM port on the platform is associated with this port.
Defines the baud rate for this port.
Specifies the T1 (Inter-character) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T2 (Block protocol) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T3 (Reply) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T4 (Inter-block) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the SECS retry limit.
Specifies the T1 (Inter-character) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T2 (Block protocol) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T3 (Reply) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the T4 (Inter-block) time-out in seconds.
Specifies the SECS retry limit.
Identifies a device definition.
Determines which port a device will use. The port must be defined in a prior port definition in the same configuration file.
This is the SECS Device ID which the host will use to address messages to this equipment.
Reply Timeout. Maximum time an entity expecting a reply message will wait for that reply. Range allowed is 1 to 120 seconds in increments of 1 second.
Connect Separation Timeout. Time that must elapse between successive attempts to connect to a given remote entity. Range allowed is 1 to 240 seconds in increments of 1 second.
Control Transaction Timeout. Time that a control transaction may remain open before it is considered a communications failure. Range allowed is 1 to 240 seconds in increments of 1 second.

Not Selected Timeout. Time that a TCP/IP connection can remain in the Not Selected state (i.e., no HSMS activity) before it is considered a communications failure. Range allowed is 1 to 240 seconds in increments of 1 second.

Network Inter-character Timeout. Maximum time that can pass between successive bytes of a single HSMS message before it is considered a communications failure. Range allowed is 1 to 120 seconds in increments of 1 second.
Logic this local entity will use during HSMS connection establishment. Range is Passive or Active.

Local Entity IP Address. Required for any entity operating in Passive mode. Determines the address at which the local entity will listen for incoming connection requests. The range of this parameter is determined by local TCP/IP conventions.Note: For the GEM operating software to load and execute successfully, the IP Address field must be set to a valid network IP address.
TCP port. Extension of the IP address. The range of this parameter is determined by local TCP/IP conventions.
